title.narrative: CO-SPD&D L&A CO AFG Support Conflict & F

description.narrative: This project falls under the thematic area Conflict and Fragility. Through our work Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more marginalized groups have a say in policies that affect their lives; governments and international institutions support inclusion of women and promote protection of marginalized groups in security and peace building; and the private sector contributes to peace and development. . ToC 1) Right to Food: Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more small-scale food producers and agricultural workers, particularly women and their communities, benefit from local to global publi cand private sector policies that protect and promote their prosperity and resilience ToC 2) Greater Responsibility in Finance for Development: Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve thatmore women, youth and other citizens benefit from higher quality and quantity of finance for development, an enhanced fiscal systemand a sustainable and inclusive financial and corporate sector, tackling extreme inequality. ToC 3) Conflict and Fragility: Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more marginalized groups have a say in policies that affect their lives; governments and international institutions support inclusion of women and promote protection of marginalized groups in security and peace building; and the private sector contributes to peace and development. Within this Theory of Change, this project in Afghanistan has set the following objective: Voices and needs of Afghan women affected by conflict are represented at sub- national and international levels to enhance protection of women in public spaces, prevent gender-based violence, and gender-sensitive undertaking of relief and recovery measures aimed at the most vulnerable women and girls. The proposed project will aim to meet the following objectives to achieve the longterm outcomes; 1. To build the capacity of civil society organizations (CSOs) at the local (district) level through tailor-made training and mentoring on the policy process on NAP 1325#s Pillar 2 (Protection) <(>&<)> Pillar 4 (Relief and Recovery). 2. To build the capacity of civil society organizations at the local and national levels on evidence-based advocacy. 3. To raise the awareness of non-state actors, particularly traditional community and religious leaders, at the local (district) level on NAP 1325 so to enable them to hold the government accountable on its commitments under NAP 1325. 4. To build the capacity of state actors on the policy process on NAP 1325 with a specific focus on Pillar 2 (Protection) and Pillar 4 (Relief and Recovery). 5. To develop an evidence-based mechanism for monitoring progress toward NAP objectives, with a focus on Pillar 2 and 4. 6. To strengthen state-CSO dialogue and cooperation on gender equality and women#s rights using NAP 1325 as the policy instrument, and building on structures and impacts resulting from Oxfam Novib#s Citizens First, Bayan, and RiC projects. To achieve this long-term outcome in Afghanistan Oxfam works together with the following partners: Afghanistan Public Policy and Research (APPRO) and Peace Training and Research Organization (PTRO). APPRO is contributing to our joint effort through <(><<)>Baseline, Training and Mentoring, Monitoring, Outreach and Advocacy. Oxfam Novib willwork closely with its partners APPRO and PTRO to implement the activities for National Action Plan (NAP) 1325 and have theresponsibility for donor contract management, overall MEAL, reporting and will provide technical and advisory support to partners, PTRO and APPRO, for the implementation of #Citizens for 1325#. The responsibility for the overall project monitoring, evaluation, and learning rests with Oxfam Novib as the contract manager. 1. By 2018, 30 Afghan CSOs (including Women#s Organizations) have increased thematic and operational capacity and formed a stronger alliance to engage in advocacy trajectories, and hold the Afghan government accountable on its commitments to Pillar 2 (protection) and Pillar 4 (relief and recovery) as stated in the NAP1325 adopted in June 2015. 2. By 2018, the CSOs and WOs involved in this program have become structurally involved in the monitoring and proper implementation of Pillar 2 and 4 of the NAP 1325, based on the voices of women in the target areas through anew monitoring and advocacy mechanism, which fosters both critical and constructive engagement with the relevant authorities at the Provincial level 3. By 2018, the CSOs and WOs involved in this program, as well as global actors, have been structurally involved in the monitoring of the proper implementation of Pillar 2 and 4 of NAP 1325, based on the voices of women in the target areas, through a new monitoring and advocacy mechanism that fosters both critical and constructive engagement with the relevantauthorities at national level. Kabul, Daikundi and Balkh Baseline (Baseline for NAP 1325), Training and Mentoring (Research skills, and advocacy), Monitoring (annual monitoring of NAP 1325), Outreach and advocacy (quarterly meetings between Provincial Advocacy Committees, annual workshops, annual events, lobby activities.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam works to help poor and marginalized people to gain control over their own lives by exercising their right to political participation, freedom of expression and information, freedom of assembly, and access to justice. Many projects currently being executed by Oxfam in Afghanistan on women and youth fall under this campaign.
In Afghanistan, ON has been working with local NGOs, civil society organisations and networks through a number of initiatives to raise awareness about human rights, promote women's participation and leadership, and empower citizens to speak out on issues that affect their lives and to improve governance

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
